geneVariantDescriptions.description: CCDC6-PDGFRB results from the fusion of CCDC6 and PDGFRB (PMID: 11389034), which leads to transformation of cultured cells, tumor formation in mouse models (PMID: 11389034), and elevated Pdgfrb expression in patient cells (PMID: 20107158). CCDC6-PDGFRB has been identified in atypical chronic myeloid leukemia (PMID: 11389034, PMID: 20107158, PMID: 31327842).

references.title: H4(D10S170), a gene frequently rearranged in papillary thyroid carcinoma, is fused to the platelet-derived growth factor receptor beta gene in atypical chronic myeloid leukemia with t(5;10)(q33;q22).
Screening for diverse PDGFRA or PDGFRB fusion genes is facilitated by generic quantitative reverse transcriptase polymerase chain reaction analysis.
Myeloid/Lymphoid Neoplasm with PDGFRB Rearrangement with t (5;10) (q33;q22) Harboring a Novel Breakpoint of the CCDC6-PDGFRB Fusion Gene.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a clinical case study, a patient with CCDC6-PDGFRB positive atypical chronic myeloid leukemia experienced complete cytogenetic response after three months of Gleevec (imatinib) treatment, and remained in molecular remission for three years (PMID: 31327842).

references.title: Myeloid/Lymphoid Neoplasm with PDGFRB Rearrangement with t (5;10) (q33;q22) Harboring a Novel Breakpoint of the CCDC6-PDGFRB Fusion Gene.
